page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY - NORTH TAWTON
page.content: There was a{ROMAN}settlement at North Tawton called NEMETESTATIO.This was a signal station or fort on the main {ROMAN}road from Exeter to Cornwall. NEMET means "the place of the shrine in the wood".The word NYMET appears in a number of local placenames. In{NORMAN}times North Tawton appears as TAWETONA and TAWLAND(Domesday Book) and later in{1270}as CHEPING TAUTON. The name TAWTON means "farmstead on the silent water"The population at this time was about 600. In{1374}North Tawton had its first {Market Charter}together with a three days{Fair}at the{Feast of St.Nicholas} (6th.Dec.).The market lapsed about 1730 but the Fair survived under different dates until earlier this century by which time it had become a Cattle Fair.
